ground_truth: Draco is in a cluttered room, he pauses, looks around, tossing an apple, and turns as he hears creaking behind him. He hauls down a heavy cloth cover, revealing a tall triangular cabinet similar to the one in Borgin and Burke shop, and studies it closely. A lone student flies over the Quidditch stadium as Harry and Ginny stand facing the Gryffindor triallists, who all turn toward them. Ron stands stiffly wearing a protective leather helmet, and from the stands, Hermione waves to him. Cormac swaggers up to Ron, catches a fly, slaps Ron's arm, and marches off, leaving Ron looking miserable. Cormac flies confidently towards a circular goalpost as Ron almost slips off his broomstick heading for the opposing goal, watched closely by Lavender. Cormac smirks, catching Hermione's eye, and she glances away, then back as the trials begin and two players collide and fall. Holding a round leather Quaffle, Ginny aims it at Cormac's goal; he punches it away with his right hand, kicks another, and punches a third with his left hand before grabbing hold of the next Quaffle. It's Ron's turn to protect his goal; he punches and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a Quaffle unseats him, leaving him dangling from the end of his broomstick as Lavender gets up on her feet rooting for him. Ron regains his seat on the broomstick, and watched by Hermione, clings on anxiously as two chasers zoom past Harry and Cormac smirks confidently. Hermione whispers into her hand, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle flies past him through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, Hermione pulls a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. Harry closes it and gets up, Ginny grabs it from him, Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry who shifts awkwardly, Ginny tosses the book back, and Harry walks away as both girls watch him leave. In his room, Harry sits at a table with the book open in front of him, notes scribbled all over its pages. Walking in the snow, Flitwick passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks where Harry sees Draco, who walks out. Ron spots Ginny with Dean Thomas, Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean kiss at their corner table. Ron turns, clenches his jaw, scowls at Harry, leans on the table, raises his eyebrows, glances at Hermione, and points to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then gazes at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie are walking ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: Draco is in a cluttered chamber, he hesitates, glances around, tossing an apple, and swivels as he hears creaking behind him. He pulls down a heavy fabric cover, revealing a tall triangular cupboard similar to the one in Borgin and Burke shop, and examines it closely. A solitary student flies over the Quidditch stadium as Harry and Ginny stand facing the Gryffindor triallists, who all turn toward them. Ron stands stiffly wearing a protective leather helmet, and from the bleachers, Hermione waves to him. Cormac struts up to Ron, catches a fly, slaps Ron's arm, and strides off, leaving Ron looking dejected. Cormac flies assuredly towards a circular goalpost as Ron almost slips off his broomstick heading for the opposing goal, watched closely by Lavender. Cormac smirks, catching Hermione's eye, and she glances away, then back as the trials commence and two players collide and tumble. Holding a round leather Quaffle, Ginny targets it at Cormac's goal; he punches it away with his right hand, kicks another, and punches a third with his left hand before seizing hold of the next Quaffle. It's Ron's turn to defend his goal; he punches and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a Quaffle unseats him, leaving him dangling from the end of his broomstick as Lavender gets up on her feet rooting for him. Ron regains his seat on the broomstick, and watched by Hermione, clings on anxiously as two chasers zoom past Harry and Cormac smirks confidently. Hermione whispers into her hand, smiles as Cormac is jolted sideways, and the Quaffle flies past him through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the Gryffindor common chamber, Hermione pulls a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. Harry closes it and gets up, Ginny grabs it from him, Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry who shifts awkwardly, Ginny tosses the book back, and Harry strides away as both girls watch him depart. In his chamber, Harry sits at a table with the book open in front of him, notes scribbled all over its pages. Walking in the snow, Flitwick passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks where Harry spots Draco, who strides out. Ron notices Ginny with Dean Thomas, Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean kiss at their corner table. Ron turns, clenches his jaw, scowls at Harry, leans on the table, raises his eyebrows, glances at Hermione, and points to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then gazes at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie are walking ahead of them.

test_cases.description: Draco is in a cluttered room; he pauses, looks around, tosses an apple, and turns as creaking is heard behind him. A heavy cloth cover is hauled down by him, revealing a tall triangular cabinet similar to the one in the Borgin and Burke shop, and it is studied closely by him. Over the Quidditch stadium, a lone student flies as Harry and Ginny stand facing the Gryffindor triallists, who all turn toward them. Ron is approached by Cormac, who catches a fly, slaps Ron's arm, and marches off, leaving Ron looking miserable. Cormac flies confidently towards a circular goalpost while Ron almost slips off his broomstick heading for the opposing goal, watching him closely is Lavender. Ginny, holding a round leather Quaffle, aims it at Cormac's goal; it is punched away by him with his right hand, another is kicked, and a third is punched with his left hand before he grabs hold of the next Quaffle. Ron's turn to protect his goal comes; he punches and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a Quaffle unseats him, leaving him dangling from the end of his broomstick as Lavender gets up on her feet, rooting for him. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away, leaving him swinging helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, a face is pulled by Hermione as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. It is closed by Harry, who gets up, Ginny grabs it from him, Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry who shifts awkwardly, and the book is tossed back by Ginny while Harry walks away as both girls watch him leave. In his room, Harry sits at a table with the book open in front of him, its pages scribbled all over with notes. The trio is passed by Flitwick, who is walking in the snow near the Three Broomsticks, where Draco is seen by Harry, walking out. Ginny with Dean Thomas is spotted by Ron, and Hermione looks over at them as a kiss is shared by Ginny and Dean at their corner table. Ron turns, clenches his jaw, scowls at Harry, leans on the table, raises his eyebrows, glances at Hermione, and points to his upper lip. The butterbeer froth is wiped from her lip by Hermione with her sleeve, then she gazes at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie walk ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: Draco stands in a cluttered room, pauses, tosses an apple, and turns at a creak. He uncovers a tall triangular cabinet like one in Borgin and Burke's and examines it. A student flies over the Quidditch stadium as Harry and Ginny face the Gryffindor triallists. Ron, in a leather helmet, stands stiffly while Hermione waves from the stands. Cormac swaggers up, slaps Ron's arm, and leaves him looking miserable. Cormac confidently flies toward a goalpost as Ron nearly slips off his broom, watched by Lavender. Cormac smirks at Hermione, who glances away as trials begin and two players collide. Ginny aims a Quaffle at Cormac's goal; he punches it away, kicks another, and grabs the next. Ron's turn comes; he wildly deflects shots but is unseated by a Quaffle, dangling from his broom as Lavender cheers. Ron regains his seat, clinging anxiously as chasers zoom past. Hermione whispers, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle scores. A Quaffle hits Ron's head, bouncing away as he swings helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, Hermione makes a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves and glares. Harry closes a book, Ginny grabs it, and Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry, who shifts awkwardly. Ginny tosses the book back, and Harry walks away as they watch. In his room, Harry sits with the book open, notes scribbled on its pages. Walking in the snow, Flitwick passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks, where Harry sees Draco. Ron spots Ginny with Dean Thomas, and Hermione watches them kiss. Ron scowls at Harry, leans on the table, raises his eyebrows, glances at Hermione, and points to his lip. Hermione wipes butterbeer froth from her lip, gazes at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie walk ahead.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: Draco pauses in a cluttered room, tossing an apple, and turns at a creak. He uncovers a triangular cabinet like one in Borgin and Burke's. A student flies over the Quidditch stadium as Harry and Ginny face Gryffindor triallists. Ron, in a leather helmet, stands stiffly; Hermione waves from the stands. Cormac swaggers, slaps Ron's arm, and leaves him miserable. Cormac flies confidently, while Ron nearly slips, watched by Lavender. Cormac smirks at Hermione, who looks away as trials begin and players collide. Ginny aims a Quaffle at Cormac's goal; he deflects it. Ron defends his goal wildly but is unseated by a Quaffle, dangling as Lavender cheers. Ron regains his seat, watched by Hermione, as Cormac smirks. Hermione whispers, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle scores. A Quaffle hits Ron's head, bouncing away. In the Gryffindor common room, Hermione reacts as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves and glares. Harry closes a book, Ginny grabs it, and Harry walks away as the girls watch. In his room, Harry sits with the book, notes scribbled on its pages. Walking in snow, Flitwick passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks, where Harry sees Draco. Ron spots Ginny with Dean Thomas, who kiss. Ron scowls at Harry, gestures to Hermione, who wipes butterbeer froth from her lip, then gazes at Ron. Leanne and Katie walk ahead on the way back.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: Draco finds himself standing in a room that is cluttered with various items. He pauses for a moment, taking in his surroundings, and casually tosses an apple in his hand. Suddenly, he turns around as he hears the sound of creaking coming from behind him. With a determined motion, he pulls down a heavy cloth cover, unveiling a tall, triangular cabinet that bears a striking resemblance to one found in the Borgin and Burke shop. He examines it closely, studying its details with great interest. Meanwhile, a lone student is seen flying over the expansive Quidditch stadium, where Harry and Ginny are standing, facing the Gryffindor triallists. All the triallists turn their attention toward them. Ron stands there, looking rather stiff, wearing a protective leather helmet, while Hermione waves to him enthusiastically from the stands. Cormac approaches Ron with a swagger, catches a fly with ease, slaps Ron's arm in a dismissive manner, and then marches off, leaving Ron feeling quite miserable. Cormac then flies confidently toward a circular goalpost, while Ron, almost slipping off his broomstick, heads for the opposing goal, closely watched by Lavender. Cormac smirks, catching Hermione's eye, and she glances away, only to look back as the trials commence and two players collide, falling dramatically. Ginny, holding a round leather Quaffle, aims it at Cormac's goal; he skillfully punches it away with his right hand, kicks another shot, and punches a third with his left hand before successfully grabbing hold of the next Quaffle. Now it's Ron's turn to defend his goal; he punches and kicks out wildly, managing to deflect several shots, but a Quaffle hits him, unseating him and leaving him dangling precariously from the end of his broomstick as Lavender stands up, cheering for him. Ron manages to regain his seat on the broomstick, and under Hermione's watchful eye, clings on anxiously as two chasers zoom past Harry, while Cormac smirks with confidence. Hermione whispers into her hand, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle flies past him, scoring through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the cozy Gryffindor common room, Hermione makes a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. Harry closes the book he was reading and gets up, but Ginny quickly grabs it from him. Hermione and Ginny both stare at Harry, who shifts awkwardly under their gaze. Ginny tosses the book back to him, and Harry walks away, feeling their eyes on him as he leaves. In his room, Harry sits at a table with the book open in front of him, its pages covered with notes scribbled all over. As they walk in the snow, Flitwick passes by the trio near the Three Broomsticks, where Harry spots Draco, who is walking out. Ron notices Ginny with Dean Thomas, and Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean share a kiss at their corner table. Ron turns away, clenching his jaw, scowling at Harry, leaning on the table, raising his eyebrows, and glancing at Hermione before pointing to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then gazes at Ron, and on their way back, Leanne and Katie are walking ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description: Draco Malfoy finds himself standing in a room that is cluttered with an assortment of various items scattered haphazardly around. He pauses for a brief moment, taking in every detail of his surroundings, and casually tosses an apple up and down in his hand. Suddenly, he turns sharply around as he hears the distinct sound of creaking coming from somewhere behind him. With a determined motion, he pulls down a heavy cloth cover, revealing a tall, triangular cabinet that bears an uncanny resemblance to one found in the infamous Borgin and Burke shop. He examines it closely, studying its intricate details with great interest and scrutiny. Meanwhile, a solitary student is seen flying over the expansive and well-known Quidditch stadium, where Harry and Ginny are standing, facing the eager Gryffindor triallists. All the triallists turn their undivided attention toward them, focusing intently. Ron stands there looking rather stiff and uncomfortable, wearing a protective leather helmet, while Hermione waves to him enthusiastically from the stands. Cormac approaches Ron with a swagger, nonchalantly catches a fly with ease, slaps Ron's arm in a dismissive manner, and then marches off, leaving Ron feeling quite miserable and dejected. Cormac then flies confidently toward a circular goalpost, while Ron, almost slipping off his broomstick, heads for the opposing goal, closely monitored by Lavender. Cormac smirks, catching Hermione's eye, and she glances away, only to look back as the trials commence and two players collide and fall dramatically. Ginny, holding a round leather Quaffle, aims it precisely at Cormac's goal. With skill, he punches it away using his right hand, kicks another shot, and punches a third with his left hand before successfully grabbing hold of the next Quaffle. Now it's Ron's turn to defend his goal; he punches and kicks out wildly, managing to deflect several shots. A Quaffle, however, hits him, unseating him and leaving him dangling precariously from the end of his broomstick as Lavender stands up, cheering loudly for him. Ron manages to regain his seat on the broomstick, and under Hermione's watchful eye, clings on anxiously as two chasers zoom past Harry, while Cormac smirks with confidence. Hermione whispers into her hand, smiling as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle flies past him, scoring through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the cozy Gryffindor common room, Hermione makes a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. Harry closes the book he was reading and gets up, but Ginny quickly grabs it from him. Hermione and Ginny both stare intently at Harry, who shifts awkwardly under their combined gaze. Ginny tosses the book back to him, and Harry walks away, feeling their eyes on him as he leaves. In his room, Harry sits at a table with the book wide open in front of him, its pages covered with notes scribbled chaotically all over. As they walk in the snow, Flitwick passes by the trio near the bustling Three Broomsticks, where Harry spots Draco, who is walking out. Ron notices Ginny with Dean Thomas, and Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean share a kiss at their cozy corner table. Ron turns away, clenching his jaw, scowling at Harry, who is leaning on the table, raising his eyebrows, and then glancing at Hermione before discreetly pointing to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then gazes at Ron, and on their way back, Leanne and Katie are seen walking ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: In the cluttered room, Draco stands still for a moment, taking in his surroundings with a careful gaze. He casually tosses an apple in his hand, his attention momentarily diverted by the sound of creaking behind him. Turning towards the noise, he decisively pulls down a heavy cloth cover, unveiling a tall triangular cabinet that bears a striking resemblance to one found in the Borgin and Burke shop. He leans in, examining it with keen interest. Meanwhile, a lone student soars over the Quidditch stadium, where Harry and Ginny stand facing the Gryffindor triallists, who collectively pivot to focus on them. Ron stands rigidly, donned in a protective leather helmet, while Hermione, seated in the stands, waves encouragingly at him. Cormac approaches Ron with a swagger, deftly catches a fly, gives Ron's arm a playful slap, and strides away, leaving Ron feeling dejected. Cormac then flies with assurance towards a circular goalpost, as Ron, struggling to maintain his balance, nearly slips off his broomstick while heading for the opposing goal, all under the watchful eye of Lavender. Cormac, with a smirk, catches Hermione's eye, prompting her to look away momentarily before glancing back as the trials commence and two players collide and tumble. Ginny, holding a round leather Quaffle, takes aim at Cormac's goal; he skillfully punches it away with his right hand, kicks another attempt, and uses his left hand to punch a third before securely grabbing the next Quaffle. When it's Ron's turn to defend his goal, he flails wildly, punching and kicking to deflect shots, but a Quaffle strikes him, causing him to dangle precariously from the end of his broomstick as Lavender stands up, cheering him on. Ron manages to regain his seat on the broomstick, clinging on nervously under Hermione's watchful gaze as two chasers speed past Harry, and Cormac exudes confidence with a smirk. Hermione discreetly whispers into her hand, smiling as Cormac is suddenly jerked sideways, allowing the Quaffle to sail past him through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron strikes his head and bounces away, leaving him swinging helplessly. Later, in the Gryffindor common room, Hermione makes a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves at him and glares. Harry closes a book and stands up, prompting Ginny to snatch it from him. Hermione and Ginny fix their eyes on Harry, who shifts uncomfortably under their gaze. Ginny tosses the book back to him, and Harry walks away, feeling their eyes on him as he departs. In his room, Harry sits at a table, the book open before him, its pages covered in scribbled notes. Outside, in the snow, Flitwick walks past the trio near the Three Broomsticks, where Harry spots Draco exiting. Ron notices Ginny with Dean Thomas, and Hermione glances over as Ginny and Dean share a kiss at their corner table. Ron turns away, his jaw clenched in frustration, and scowls at Harry. He leans on the table, raises his eyebrows, and gestures towards his upper lip. Hermione, catching the hint, wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then looks at Ron. On their way back, Leanne and Katie walk ahead of them, completing the scene.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: Draco stands in a cluttered room, pausing to look around as he tosses an apple and turns at the sound of creaking. He uncovers a tall triangular cabinet, similar to one from Borgin and Burke's, and examines it closely. Meanwhile, at the Quidditch stadium, a lone student flies overhead as Harry and Ginny face the Gryffindor triallists. Ron, wearing a protective helmet, stands stiffly while Hermione waves from the stands. Cormac approaches Ron, catches a fly, slaps his arm, and walks off, leaving Ron looking dejected. Cormac confidently flies toward a goalpost as Ron, nearly slipping off his broomstick, heads for the opposing goal, observed by Lavender. Cormac smirks at Hermione, who looks away and then back as the trials begin with two players colliding. Ginny, holding a Quaffle, aims at Cormac's goal; he deflects it with his hands and feet before catching the next one. When it's Ron's turn, he wildly deflects shots but is unseated by a Quaffle, leaving him dangling as Lavender cheers him on. Ron regains his seat, clinging anxiously as Hermione watches and Cormac smirks. Hermione whispers into her hand, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, allowing a Quaffle to score. A Quaffle hits Ron's head, leaving him swinging helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, Hermione reacts as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves and glares at him. Harry closes a book, gets up, and Ginny grabs it, tossing it back after a brief exchange. Harry walks away under the watchful eyes of Hermione and Ginny. In his room, Harry sits at a table with the book open, notes scribbled across its pages. Outside, Flitwick passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks, where Harry spots Draco exiting. Ron notices Ginny with Dean Thomas, and Hermione observes as they kiss at their table. Ron turns, scowls at Harry, and signals Hermione to wipe butterbeer froth from her lip, which she does before gazing at Ron. On their way back, Leanne and Katie walk ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: Draco is in a cluttered room filled with relics and magical artifacts, he pauses, looks around, tossing an apple, a fruit often associated with health and knowledge, and turns as he hears creaking behind him. He hauls down a heavy cloth cover, revealing a tall triangular cabinet designed in the antique style reminiscent of the one in Borgin and Burke shop, a known purveyor of Dark Arts items in Knockturn Alley, and studies it closely. A lone student flies over the Quidditch stadium, the iconic arena for wizarding sport at Hogwarts, as Harry and Ginny stand facing the Gryffindor triallists, who all turn toward them. Ron stands stiffly wearing a protective leather helmet, standard gear in Quidditch to prevent head injuries, and from the stands, Hermione waves to him. Cormac, known for his overconfidence, swaggers up to Ron, catches a fly with surprising dexterity, slaps Ron's arm condescendingly, and marches off, leaving Ron looking miserable. Cormac flies confidently towards a circular goalpost, one of three that each team must defend in Quidditch, as Ron almost slips off his broomstick heading for the opposing goal, watched closely by Lavender, whose interests are clearly not just in the game. Cormac smirks, catching Hermione's eye, and she glances away, then back as the trials begin and two players collide and fall. Holding a round leather Quaffle, the primary ball used in scoring during the game, Ginny aims it at Cormac's goal; he punches it away with his right hand, kicks another with skill, and punches a third with his left hand before grabbing hold of the next Quaffle. It's Ron's turn to protect his goal; he punches and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a Quaffle unseats him, leaving him dangling from the end of his broomstick as Lavender gets up on her feet rooting for him. Ron regains his seat on the broomstick, and watched by Hermione, clings on anxiously as two chasers, the players responsible for scoring, zoom past Harry and Cormac smirks confidently. Hermione whispers into her hand, casting a subtle spell unnoticed by most, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle flies past him through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head, a common hazard in such an intense match, and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, a cozy but lively hub for the house members, Hermione pulls a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. Harry closes it, the book filled with mysterious handwritten spells and notes from the Half-Blood Prince, and gets up, Ginny grabs it from him, Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry who shifts awkwardly, Ginny tosses the book back, and Harry walks away as both girls watch him leave. In his room, Harry sits at a table with the book open in front of him, notes scribbled all over its pages highlighting its importance. Walking in the snow, Flitwick, the diminutive Charms professor at Hogwarts, passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks, a popular pub in Hogsmeade, where Harry sees Draco, who walks out wearing an inscrutable expression. Ron spots Ginny with Dean Thomas, another Gryffindor student, Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean kiss at their corner table. Ron turns, clenches his jaw, scowls at Harry, leans on the table, raises his eyebrows, glances at Hermione, and points to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then gazes at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie are walking ahead of them, their conversation occasionally punctuated by laughter.

Cormac smirks catching Hermione's eye and she glances away then back as the trials begin and two players collide and fall. It is Ron's turn to protect his goal. he punches and kicks out wildly deflecting shots but a Quaffle unseats him leaving him dangling from the end of his broomstick as Lavender gets up on her feet rooting for him. Ron regains his seat on the broomstick and watched by Hermione clings on anxiously as two chasers zoom past Harry and Cormac smirks confidently. Hermione whispers into her hand smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways and the Quaffle flies past him through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry who shifts awkwardly. Ginny tosses the book back and Harry walks away as both girls watch him leave. In his room Harry sits at a table with the book open in front of him. notes scribbled all over its pages. Walking in the snow Flitwick passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks where Harry sees Draco who walks out. Ron spots Ginny with Dean Thomas. Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean kiss at their corner table. Ron turns clenches his jaw scowls at. Harry leans on the table raises his eyebrows glances at Hermione and points to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve then gazes at Ron and on the way back. Leanne and Katie are walking ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Subject Corruption
test_cases.description: The cat is in a cluttered room, it pauses, looks around, tossing an apple, and turns as it hears creaking behind it. The turtle hauls down a heavy cloth cover, revealing a tall triangular cabinet similar to the one in Borgin and Burke shop, and studies it closely. A lone dog flies over the Quidditch stadium as the owl and the rabbit stand facing the Gryffindor triallists, who all turn toward them. The elephant stands stiffly wearing a protective leather helmet, and from the stands, the giraffe waves to the elephant. The lion swaggers up to the elephant, catches a fly, slaps the elephant's arm, and marches off, leaving the elephant looking miserable. The lion flies confidently towards a circular goalpost as the elephant almost slips off its broomstick heading for the opposing goal, watched closely by the kangaroo. The lion smirks, catching the giraffe's eye, and the giraffe glances away, then back as the trials begin and two players collide and fall. Holding a round leather Quaffle, the rabbit aims it at the lion's goal; it punches it away with its right hand, kicks another, and punches a third with its left hand before grabbing hold of the next Quaffle. It's the elephant's turn to protect its goal; it punches and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a Quaffle unseats it, leaving it dangling from the end of its broomstick as the kangaroo gets up on its feet rooting for it. The elephant regains its seat on the broomstick, and watched by the giraffe, clings on anxiously as two chasers zoom past the owl and the lion smirks confidently. The giraffe whispers into its hand, smiles as the lion is jerked sideways, and the Quaffle flies past it through the goal. A Quaffle aimed at the elephant hits its head and bounces away as it swings helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, the giraffe pulls a face as the elephant glances at the kangaroo, who waves to it and glares at the elephant. The owl closes it and gets up, the rabbit grabs it from the owl, the giraffe and the rabbit stare at the owl who shifts awkwardly, the rabbit tosses the book back, and the owl walks away as both animals watch it leave. In its room, the owl sits at a table with the book open in front of it, notes scribbled all over its pages. Walking in the snow, the fox passes the trio near the Three Broomsticks where the owl sees the cat, who walks out. The elephant spots the rabbit with the deer, the giraffe looks over at them as the rabbit and the deer kiss at their corner table. The elephant turns, clenches its jaw, scowls at the owl, leans on the table, raises its eyebrows, glances at the giraffe, and points to its upper lip. The giraffe wipes the butterbeer froth from its lip with its sleeve, then gazes at the elephant, and on the way back, the squirrel and the duck are walking ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Draco is in a cluttered attic, he pauses, looks around, tossing an orange, and turns as he hears creaking behind him. He hauls down a heavy velvet curtain, revealing a tall hexagonal display case similar to the one in Zonko's Joke Shop, and studies it closely. A lone student flies over the archery field as Harry and Ginny stand facing the Slytherin candidates, who all turn toward them. Ron stands stiffly wearing a protective metal helmet, and from the bleachers, Hermione waves to him. Cormac swaggers up to Ron, catches a moth, slaps Ron's shoulder, and marches off, leaving Ron looking miserable. Cormac flies confidently towards a rectangular target as Ron almost slips off his paraglider heading for the opposing target, watched closely by Lavender. Cormac smirks, catching Hermione's eye, and she glances away, then back as the trials begin and two competitors collide and fall. Holding a round wooden melon, Ginny aims it at Cormac's target; he punches it away with his right fist, kicks another, and punches a third with his left fist before grabbing hold of the next melon. It's Ron's turn to protect his target; he punches and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a melon unseats him, leaving him dangling from the end of his paraglider as Lavender gets up on her feet rooting for him. Ron regains his seat on the paraglider, and watched by Hermione, clings on anxiously as two archers zoom past Harry and Cormac smirks confidently. Hermione whispers into her hand, smiles as Cormac is jerked sideways, and the melon flies past him through the target. A melon aimed at Ron hits his head and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the Slytherin common room, Hermione pulls a face as Ron glances at Lavender, who waves to him and glares at Ron. Harry closes it and gets up, Ginny grabs it from him, Hermione and Ginny stare at Harry who shifts awkwardly, Ginny tosses the magazine back, and Harry walks away as both girls watch him leave. In his dormitory, Harry sits at a desk with the magazine open in front of him, notes scribbled all over its pages. Walking in the rain, Flitwick passes the trio near the Hog's Head Inn where Harry sees Draco, who walks out. Ron spots Ginny with Dean Thomas, Hermione looks over at them as Ginny and Dean kiss at their corner booth. Ron turns, clenches his jaw, scowls at Harry, leans on the booth, raises his eyebrows, glances at Hermione, and points to his upper lip. Hermione wipes the pumpkin juice froth from her lip with her sleeve, then gazes at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie are walking ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Action Corruption
test_cases.description: Draco is in a cluttered room, he lingers, glances around, juggling an apple, and pivots as he hears rustling behind him. He drags up a heavy cloth cover, obscuring a tall triangular cabinet similar to the one in Borgin and Burke shop, and ignores it completely. A lone student swims over the Quidditch stadium as Harry and Ginny sit facing the Gryffindor triallists, who all turn away from them. Ron stands casually wearing a protective leather helmet, and from the stands, Hermione shouts to him. Cormac ambles up to Ron, grabs a fly, pats Ron's arm, and skips off, leaving Ron looking puzzled. Cormac dances confidently towards a circular goalpost as Ron almost slides off his broomstick moving for the opposing goal, watched closely by Lavender. Cormac grins, catching Hermione's eye, and she looks away, then back as the trials start and two players embrace and fall. Holding a round leather Quaffle, Ginny hurls it at Cormac's goal; he brushes it away with his right hand, nudges another, and taps a third with his left hand before losing hold of the next Quaffle. It's Ron's turn to avoid his goal; he flails and spins wildly, redirecting shots, but a Quaffle tips him, leaving him clutching the end of his broomstick as Lavender jumps up on her feet cheering for him. Ron regains his position on the broomstick, and watched by Hermione, hovers anxiously as two chasers float past Harry and Cormac grins confidently. Hermione murmurs into her hand, grins as Cormac is nudged sideways, and the Quaffle drifts past him through the goal. A Quaffle directed at Ron hits his head and rolls away as he dangles helplessly. In the Gryffindor common room, Hermione frowns as Ron peers at Lavender, who nods to him and giggles at Ron. Harry opens it and sits down, Ginny hands it to him, Hermione and Ginny glance at Harry who shuffles awkwardly, Ginny throws the book back, and Harry strolls away as both girls follow him with their eyes. In his room, Harry lies on a bed with the book closed in front of him, notes neatly pressed between its pages. Running in the snow, Flitwick approaches the trio near the Three Broomsticks where Harry notices Draco, who skips out. Ron observes Ginny with Dean Thomas, Hermione peeks over at them as Ginny and Dean embrace at their corner table. Ron turns, clenches his jaw, grins at Harry, sits on the table, lowers his eyebrows, gazes at Hermione, and taps his upper lip. Hermione rubs the butterbeer froth from her lip with her sleeve, then squints at Ron, and on the way back, Leanne and Katie are running ahead of them.

test_cases.name: Subject-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Daisy is in a spacious barn, she pauses, looks around, tossing a carrot, and turns as she hears whistling behind her. She tugs down a thick rug cover, revealing a short rectangular wardrobe similar to the one in Plunket and Paddle shop, and examines it closely. A lone teacher sails over the swimming pool as Lily and Oliver stand facing the Ravenclaw players, who all turn toward them. Neville stands awkwardly wearing a protective rubber suit, and from the bleachers, Luna waves to him. Seamus strides up to Neville, catches a butterfly, taps Neville's shoulder, and strides off, leaving Neville looking despondent. Seamus flies confidently towards a square goalpost as Neville almost slips off his skateboard heading for the rival goal, watched closely by Pansy. Seamus grins, catching Luna's eye, and she glances away, then back as the trials begin and two jumpers collide and trip. Holding a round rubber Bludger, Lily aims it at Seamus's goal; he bats it away with his right foot, nudges another, and bats a third with his left foot before grabbing hold of the next Bludger. It's Neville's turn to defend his goal; he flails and kicks out wildly, deflecting shots, but a Bludger unseats him, leaving him dangling from the end of his skateboard as Pansy gets up on her feet cheering for him. Neville regains his seat on the skateboard, and watched by Luna, clings on nervously as two dodgers zoom past Lily and Seamus grins confidently. Luna whispers into her scarf, smiles as Seamus is yanked sideways, and the Bludger flies past him through the hoop. A Bludger aimed at Neville hits his elbow and bounces away as he swings helplessly. In the Ravenclaw lounge, Luna pulls a face as Neville glances at Pansy, who waves to him and glares at Neville. Lily closes it and stands up, Oliver grabs it from him, Luna and Oliver stare at Lily who shifts awkwardly, Oliver tosses the scroll back, and Lily walks away as both girls watch him leave. In his shed, Lily sits at a desk with the map open in front of him, scribbles jotted all over its pages. Strolling in the rain, Trelawney passes the duo near the Three Cauldrons where Lily sees Daisy, who steps out. Neville spots Oliver with Justin Finch-Fletchley, Luna looks over at them as Oliver and Justin hug at their corner bench. Neville turns, clenches his fist, scowls at Lily, leans on the bench, raises his eyebrows, glances at Luna, and points to his chin. test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: Gizmo is in a tidy garden, he dances, glances upward, bouncing a tomato, and leaps as he hears singing beside him. He pulls up a light paper blanket, exposing a short circular sculpture similar to the one in Grubble and Grumps store, and sketches it loosely. A single bird floats above the tennis court as Sam and Lola sit facing the Ravenclaw artists, who all spin toward them. Max sits casually wearing a colorful felt cap, and from the windowsill, Beth claps for him. Edgar struts over to Max, snatches a bee, taps Max's shoulder, and strolls off, leaving Max looking cheerful. Edgar dives eagerly towards a rectangular archway as Max almost hops off his skateboard veering for the nearby arch, observed keenly by Lily. Edgar grins, catching Beth's attention, and she looks away, then back as the games commence and two cyclists bump and stop. Gripping a square rubber frisbee, Lola launches it at Edgar's net; he kicks it aside with his left foot, punches another, and headbutts a third with his right foot before snatching the next frisbee. It's Max's chance to guard his net; he waves and flails fervently, blocking throws, but a frisbee unbalances him, leaving him hanging from the side of his board as Lily climbs on her chair cheering for him. Max regains his balance on the skateboard, and watched by Beth, holds on nervously as two sprinters dash past Sam and Edgar grins eagerly. Beth murmurs into her napkin, grins as Edgar is nudged backward, and the frisbee sails past him through the net. A frisbee aimed at Max skims his ear and rolls away as he spins clumsily. In the Ravenclaw lounge, Beth makes a grimace as Max peeks at Lily, who cheers for him and laughs at Max. Sam closes it and stands up, Lola snatches it from him, Beth and Lola glance at Sam who shuffles uneasily, Lola flings the magazine back, and Sam strolls off as both girls follow him with their eyes. In his den, Sam lies on a mat with the magazine closed in front of him, doodles etched all over its cover. Walking by the lake, Missy jogs past the quartet near the Rusty Teapot where Sam spots Gizmo, who strolls out. Max notices Lola with Don Travis, Beth gazes over at them as Lola and Don laugh at their sunny table. Max spins, tightens his mouth, chuckles at Sam, leans on the chair, lowers his chin, peers at Beth, and pats his worn shoe. Beth brushes the lemonade droplets from her cheek with her hat, then smiles at Max, and on the trail back, Lucy and Marty are wandering beside them.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Draco stands in a cluttered room, tossing an apple and unveiling a triangular cabinet similar to one at Borgin and Burke's. On the Quidditch field, Harry and Ginny oversee Gryffindor trials as Ron, wearing a protective helmet, competes. Cormac taunts Ron before flying confidently, while Ron struggles to maintain balance under Lavender's watchful eye. Hermione distracts Cormac during trials, leading to Ron's successful defense despite a Quaffle hitting his head. In the Gryffindor common room, Hermione and Ginny observe Harry awkwardly before he retires to his room to study a book filled with notes. In Hogsmeade, Flitwick passes Harry, Ron, and Hermione near the Three Broomsticks, where they spot Draco. Ron sees Ginny kiss Dean, leading to tension as Hermione wipes butterbeer froth from her lip. They head home with Leanne and Katie walking ahead.
